All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
Broadcast
Broadcast message from a client that will be sent to all clients.
ClientConnectedEvent
Indicates that a new client connected to the server.
ClientDisconnectedEvent
Indicates that a client disconnected from the server.
ClientEventListener
Main ApplicationListener that routes the ClientRegisteredEvent, ClientUnregisteredEvent, and ClientDisconnectedEvent either to the NotificationService or the ClientRegistrations in order to announce connecting and disconnecting clients as Notification.
ClientRegisteredEvent
Indicates that a client has been registered.
ClientRegistrations
Associates and disassociates client names with their STOMP session id and publishes respective events, so that other components can react to new connected or leaving clients.
ClientUnregisteredEvent
Indicates that a client has been unregistered.
ConnectionEventPublisher
Intercepts the incoming MessageChannel for connecting and disconnecting clients and logs and publishes those events as StompClientEvent on the ApplicationEventPublisher.
MessageController
Handles incoming STOMP messages that were routed to the app path.
MessagingConfiguration
 
MessagingConfiguration.TopicConfiguration
 
Notification
Notification message that will be sent to all clients.
NotificationService
Broadcasts Notification messages to all clients.
Registration
Registration message that informs about a newly registered - and thus named - client
ServerApplication
 
StereotypeMessage
Adds a `type` property to the serialized object.
StompClientEvent
Indicates an event that affects a specific client.
UnregisteredClientException
Indicates that no client name is associated with the given STOMP session id
UnregisteredClientsGuard
Prevents clients from subscribing unto a topic and raises an disconnecting exception, unless they were registered beforehand.
WebSocketConfiguration
Configures STOMP, WebSocket support and logs the most important settings upon instantiation.
